This code chunk provides core graphical initialization and rendering functionality for a time slider component within an animation editing interface. The methods handle buffer management (InitBuffer), data setup (SetTimeSliderData), painting events (OnPaint), and drawing operations (DrawTimeSlider) essential for visualizing and interacting with animation timelines.

def InitBuffer(self):
        self.w,self.h = self.GetClientSize()
        self.buffer = wx.EmptyBitmap(self.w, self.h)
        dc = wx.BufferedDC(wx.ClientDC(self), self.buffer)
        self.DrawTimeSlider(dc)
        self.DrawNumber(dc)
        self.DrawFrame(dc)
        self.DrawKeys(dc)

    def SetTimeSliderData(self, sliderStartFrame = 1, sliderEndFrame = 24, curFrame = 0):
        self.curFrame = curFrame
        self.sliderStartFrame = sliderStartFrame
        self.sliderEndFrame = sliderEndFrame
        self.frameNum = self.sliderEndFrame-self.sliderStartFrame+1

        self.points = []
        self.numbers = []

        self.InitBuffer()
        self.Refresh()

    def OnPaint(self, evt):
        dc = wx.BufferedPaintDC(self, self.buffer)

    def DrawTimeSlider(self,dc):

        dc.SetBackground(wx.Brush(self.GetBackgroundColour()))
        dc.Clear()
